original: ngag sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ngag sgrub pa'i thabs zhes bya ba /

original: gsung rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Vajra of Speech.

original: sngar gyi bzhin du stong pa nyid du rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: sngar gyi bzhin du stong pa nyid du rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: As before, one should meditate on emptiness.

original: yi ge pam las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma yi ge aom las bskyed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: yi ge pam las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma yi ge aom las bskyed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: From the syllable paṃ arises a multicolored lotus, and from the syllable oṃ arises a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du yi ge hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid snang ba mtha' yas kyi skur bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las bdag nyid snang ba mtha' yas kyi skur bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Upon that, the red syllable hrīḥ transforms, and one should meditate on oneself as the form of Amitābha,

original: mnyam gzhag gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mnyam gzhag gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the mudrā of equipoise,

original: thugs rje'i mdog rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje'i mdog rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: the color of compassion, seated in the vajra posture.

original: de nas snying gar zla ba la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa gyen du langs te /
analyzed: de nas snying gar zla ba la yi ge h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje sngon po rtse lnga pa gyen du langs te /
translated: Then, in the heart, on a moon, from the syllable hūṃ arises a blue five-pronged vajra standing upright.

original: de'i dbus kyi rtse mo'i steng du yi ge a'a: dmar po bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi rtse mo'i steng du yi ge a'a: dmar po bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: On top of the center of its prongs one should meditate on the red syllable āḥ.

original: lce'i rtse me la yang yi ge hr'i: dmar po'o //
analyzed: lce'i rtse me la yang yi ge hr'i: dmar po'o //
translated: At the tip of the tongue is the red syllable hrīḥ.

original: 'di ni ngag sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: This is the means of accomplishing speech.

original: mkhas pa dag las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: mkhas pa dag las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: Translated by the learned monk Tsültrim Gyaltsen.
